poem:
### Borderlines

The morning news shuffles its papers  
in the silent halls of our minds—  
a minister's proposal flutters  
in broadcast winds.  
Eyes closed, I picture the footage:  
lives folded into suitcases,  
hopes escorted to doorsteps,  
as statistics march on,  
unbothered by compassionate whispers  
caught in the static.
